responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Command injection in configs/linux-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `configs/linux-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh` uses `ifconfig` and `route` commands to obtain network information such as IP address and gateway.
      However, it directly incorporates the output of these commands into subsequent `ifconfig` and `route` commands without proper sanitization or validation.
      An attacker who can manipulate the output of `ifconfig` or `route` can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed with root privileges.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - configs/linux-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Command injection in configs/tinylab.site/system/etc/startup.aux/start-jekyll.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `configs/tinylab.site/system/etc/startup.aux/start-jekyll.sh` is vulnerable to command injection due to the improper use of the `ifconfig` command.
      An attacker who can control the name of the network interface (`$JEKYLL_IFACE`) can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed with root privileges.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - configs/tinylab.site/system/etc/startup.aux/start-jekyll.sh
    classification: very promising
  - headline: Command injection in configs/linux-0.11-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh
    analysis: |
      The script `configs/linux-0.11-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh` uses `ifconfig` and `route` commands to obtain network information such as IP address and gateway.
      However, it directly incorporates the output of these commands into subsequent `ifconfig` and `route` commands without proper sanitization or validation.
      An attacker who can manipulate the output of `ifconfig` or `route` can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed with root privileges.
    cwe: CWE-77
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - configs/linux-0.11-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh
    classification: very promising
```

leads.headline: Command injection in configs/linux-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh
leads.analysis:
The script configs/linux-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh uses ifconfig and route commands to obtain network information such as IP address and gateway.
However, it directly incorporates the output of these commands into subsequent ifconfig and route commands without proper sanitization or validation.
An attacker who can manipulate the output of ifconfig or route can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed with root privileges.

leads.headline: Command injection in configs/tinylab.site/system/etc/startup.aux/start-jekyll.sh
leads.analysis:
The script configs/tinylab.site/system/etc/startup.aux/start-jekyll.sh is vulnerable to command injection due to the improper use of the ifconfig command.
An attacker who can control the name of the network interface ($JEKYLL_IFACE) can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed with root privileges.

leads.headline: Command injection in configs/linux-0.11-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh
leads.analysis:
The script configs/linux-0.11-lab/tools/enable_net_bridge.sh uses ifconfig and route commands to obtain network information such as IP address and gateway.
However, it directly incorporates the output of these commands into subsequent ifconfig and route commands without proper sanitization or validation.
An attacker who can manipulate the output of ifconfig or route can inject arbitrary commands that will be executed with root privileges.
